tit.cmt: 中国語読みにしました。

sen.j: 道綽（どうしゃく、Dao-chuo）は、唐代の中国浄土教の僧侶。
sen.e: Doshaku (Dao-chuo) was a Chinese monk of Tang Pure Land Sect.
Doshaku (Dao-chuo) was a Chinese monk of the Tang Pure Land sect.
Dao-chuo (Doshaku) was a Chinese monk Chinese Jodo (Pure Land) sect in the Tang.
sen.cmt: ウェブに合わせて原文・訳文修正しました。

sen.j: 浄土宗五祖の第二祖、浄土真宗七高僧の第四祖。
sen.e: He was the second founder of the five founders of Jodo Sect and the fourth founder of the seven eminent monks of Jodoshin Sect.
He was the second of the five founders of the Jodo sect and the fourth founder of the seven eminent monks of the Jodoshin sect.
He was the second of the five founders of the Jodo sect and the fourth founder of the seven eminent monks of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 14歳のときに出家し、涅槃経に精通。
sen.e: He became a monk at the age of fourteen and was well-versed in Nehan-gyo Sutra.
He became a monk at 14 years of age and was well-versed in Nehan-gyo Sutra.
He became a monk at 14 years of age and was well-versed in Nehan-gyo Sutra (The Sutra of The Great Nirvana).
sen.cmt: 用語集より補足しました。

sen.j: のち慧瓚（えさん）に師事し修行に励む。
sen.e: Later, he engaged in ascetic practices under the guidance of Esan.
Later, he engaged in ascetic practices under the guidance of Esan.
Later, he engaged in ascetic practices under the guidance of Esan.

sen.j: 48歳のとき玄中寺の曇鸞の碑文を見て感じ、自力修行の道を捨て、浄土教に帰依し同寺に滞在する。
sen.e: When he saw Donran's inscription at Genchu-ji Temple at the age of forty-eight, he realized, abandoned self-training, became the believer of Pure Land Sect and stayed at the temple.
When, at age 48, he saw Donran's inscription at Genchu-ji Temple, he realized, abandoned self-training, became a believer of the Pure Land sect and stayed at the temple.
When, at age 48, he saw Donran's inscription at Genchu-ji Temple and realized, then abandoned self-training, became a believer of the Jodo sect and stayed at the temple.

sen.j: 出家者、在家者のために『観無量寿経』を200回以上講義。
sen.e: He lectured to monks as well as lay believers on "Kan Muryoju-kyo Sutra" more than 200 times.
He gave more than 200 lectures to monks and lay believers on "Kan Muryoju-kyo Sutra."
He gave more than 200 lectures to monks and lay believers on "Kanmuryoju-kyo sutra" ('The Sutra of Visualization of the Buddha of Measureless Life,' meaning Amida).
sen.cmt: 用語集より補足しました。

sen.j: 亡くなるまで念仏を日々7万遍称えたといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that he repeated the name of Buddha seventy thousands times every day until his death.
It is said that he repeated the name of Buddha 70,000 times each day until his death.
It is said that he repeated nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) 70,000 times each day until his death.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 数珠を持って、念仏を口で称えることを奨めた。
sen.e: He exhorted to repeat the name of Buddha while holding juzu (beadroll).
He exhorted to repeat the name of Buddha while holding juzu (a roll of beads).
He exhorted to speak out nenbutsu with juzu (a roll of beads) in ones hands.
(Shomyo Nenbutsu) (invocation of the name of Buddha)
(Shomyo Nenbutsu) (invocation of the name of Buddha)
(Shomyo Nenbutsu) (invocation of the name of Buddha)

sen.j: 貞観19年（645年）4月27日、85歳にて逝去。
sen.e: He died on April 27, 645 at the age of 85.
sen.cmt: 貞観19年（645年）4月27日→中国の元号と思われますので、そのままにしてあります。日本の貞観19年４月２７日は８７７年６月１６日のようです。
sen.e: He died on April 27, 645 at the age of 85.
He died on May 27, 645 at the age of 85.
sen.cmt: 中国暦の貞観19年として、グレゴリオ暦に直しました。参考サイトhttp://db1x.sinica.edu.tw/sinocal/index.html

sen.e: "Anrakushu" two volumes
"Anrakushu," two volumes
Two volumes of "Anrakushu" (A Collection of Passages Concerning Birth in the Pure Land)
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
